speaker: Doctor
text: What symptoms have you been experiencing that led to your visit today?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't really feel anything different, but my mom said the doctor wanted to check my arm because it was a little high.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your activity level, such as feeling more tired than usual or having difficulty keeping up with friends?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I play with my friends just like always! I run and jump and have fun at school.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent illnesses, such as a cold or fever, or any changes in your diet or weight?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't been sick, and I eat the same things as always. My weight feels good, and I like my snacks!

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any headaches, dizziness, or vision changes recently?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't had any headaches or felt dizzy. My eyes are good, and I can see everything just fine!

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any family history of high blood pressure or heart problems?

speaker: Patient
text: No, my mom says nobody in our family has those problems. Everyone is healthy!

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any unusual sweating, palpitations, or chest pain during physical activities?

speaker: Patient
text: Nope, I haven't felt anything weird like that when I play. I just have fun and run around!

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any swelling in your legs, feet, or abdomen?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't seen any swelling anywhere. My legs and feet feel normal, and my tummy is fine too!

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns, such as difficulty falling asleep or staying asleep?

speaker: Patient
text: I sleep just fine! I go to bed when my mom says, and I wake up ready to play.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent blood tests or check-ups that might show any abnormalities?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any blood tests recently, but my mom says I had a check-up last time and everything was okay!

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any abdominal pain or discomfort, particularly in the upper abdomen or back?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't had any tummy aches or pain in my back. My belly feels good!

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your urine, such as increased frequency, color, or any pain while urinating?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't noticed anything different with my pee. It looks the same, and it doesn't hurt when I go!

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent injuries or accidents that might have affected your body, particularly your chest or abdomen?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't had any injuries or accidents. I play safely and haven't hurt myself at all!

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any unusual thirst or changes in your appetite recently?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't been really thirsty or anything. I eat the same amount as always and like my meals!

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent changes in your skin, such as rashes or unusual markings?

speaker: Patient
text: No, my skin looks normal! I haven't had any rashes or anything funny on my body.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent exposure to medications, supplements, or herbal remedies that could affect your blood pressure?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't taken any medicines or anything like that. I just eat my food and drink water!

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any unusual feelings in your chest, like tightness or pressure, even if it was brief?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't felt anything weird in my chest. It feels normal when I run and play!

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had your blood pressure checked multiple times, or was this the first time it was noted to be high?

speaker: Patient
text: I think this is the first time my blood pressure was checked, but my mom said it was a little high on one side.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any differences in your blood pressure readings between your arms, or has it only been checked on one side?

speaker: Patient
text: I think they only checked my arm, but my mom said it was higher on that side. I don't know if they checked the other one.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any imaging studies done, like an ultrasound of your heart or blood vessels, to check for any abnormalities?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't had any pictures taken of my heart or anything like that. My mom hasn't mentioned it.

speaker: Doctor
text: REQUEST TEST: Echocardiogram.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Narrowing of the aorta distal to the left subclavian artery with a gradient, consistent with coarctation. Left ventricular function is normal.
